intro: Dolomiaea souliei var. cinerea, commonly known as the gray dolomiaea, is a rare and striking succulent native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its dense, fleshy foliage that ranges from gray-green to silver-blue in color. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and arid landscapes. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is often cultivated by enthusiasts interested in rare succulents.
